arm_group.description: In addition to a standardized reminder letter, patients also received a telephone call from an automated system to remind them of a recommended follow-up appointment.
In addition to the usual care letter, a staff member called patients one month prior of recommended follow-up appointment. During this call, patients were given the option to schedule an appointment.
Patients randomized to this arm receive a "usual care" letter which is a standard reminder letter from the primary eye care office. This is usual practice in many primary eye care facilities.

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims to examine the effectiveness of three different ways of helping patients
      attend their recommended eye care appointments. The three ways are 1) usual care, which
      involves a standard reminder letter; 2) automated telephone calls, which utilizes a machine
      to automatically call patients one month prior to their recommended follow-up date;
      3)personalized telephone calls, which utilizes a staff member to personally call patients
      and offer them the opportunity to schedule at the time of the telephone call.

clinical_study.brief_title: Improving Follow-Up Adherence in a Primary Eye Care Setting
clinical_study.condition: Primary Eye Care Adherence, no Specific Ocular Conditions Are Being Examined.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age: Over 18 years

          -  Primary Eye Care Patients who were recommended for a 6-month, 12-month, or 24-month
             follow-up appointment during September 2013 through November 2013.

          -  Access to a telephone

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Does not speak English

clinical_study.official_title: Improving Follow-Up Adherence in a Primary Eye Care Setting: A Prospective, Randomized Controlled Trial

primary_outcome.description: A research assistant examines the Electronic Medical Records (EMR) system to assess recommended appointment adherence.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Tracking whether the patient made an appointment within 1 month of the reminder letter (usual care), automated phone call, or personalized phone call.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Factorial Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
